numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The points on the left are more than the points on the right.
3. The first age group is people who are 15 to 24 years old.
4. The second age group is people who are 40 years old or older.
5. In Brazil, some people think that the world is not getting better with each generation.
6. In Brazil, the percentage for the first age group is possibly 31%.
7. In Brazil, the percentage for the second age group is possibly 12%.
8. In Mali, some people think that the world is not getting better with each generation.
9. In Mali, the percentage for the first age group is possibly 28%.
10. In Mali, the percentage for the second age group is possibly 24%.
11. Indonesia has the highest point in the graph.
12. In Indonesia, people in both age groups think that the world is getting better with each generation.
13. Overall, young adults are more optimistic than adults.
14. Adults may have more experience than young adults.
15. Adults may see the questions more clearly than young adults.
16. Adults may think that the world is not getting better with each generation.
17. The headline is: Does each generation have a good or bad view of the world?
